Name: Hampi
Type: Historical Monument / Archaeological Site / UNESCO World Heritage
Nearest Airport: Vidyanagar/Ballari Airport (~35 km) / Bengaluru International Airport (~300 km)
Timings: Varies by monument; main ruins open daylight hours
Entry Fee: Specific monument fees vary; general entry not documented
Accessibility: Rough terrain, rocky surfaces; not fully wheelchair-friendly
Guided Tours: Local guides available
Special Notes: UNESCO World Heritage site; known for Virupaksha Temple, Vittala Temple

Name: Mysore Palace (Amba Vilas Palace)
Nearest Bus Stand: Mysuru KSRTC Bus Stand (2–3 km approx)
Nearest Airport: Mysuru Airport (~10 km); Bengaluru International (~140 km)
Accessibility: Well-paved approaches; partial wheelchair access
Guided Tours: Official guides available
Special Notes: Iconic illumination on Sundays and public holidays

Name: Lalbagh Botanical Garden
Accessibility: Well-maintained paved paths; generally wheelchair-friendly
Guided Tours: Staff/guided tours sometimes available
Special Notes: Famous for glasshouse and annual flower shows

Name: Cubbon Park
Nearest Metro Station: MG Road / Cubbon Park Metro Station
Accessibility: Paved walkways; largely accessible
Guided Tours: Occasional guided walks by local groups

Name: Bangalore Palace
Accessibility: Steps inside; limited wheelchair access
Guided Tours: Guided audio/local guides available

Name: Bannerghatta National Park
Timings: Zoo/safari timings vary; commonly morning & afternoon sessions
Accessibility: Developed park with pathways; partial accessibility
Guided Tours: Guided safaris & official naturalist services available

Name: Coorg (Madikeri)
Nearest Airport: Mangalore International Airport (~150 km) / Bengaluru (~260 km)
Timings: Individual sites vary; typically daylight hours
Entry Fee: Abbey Falls / Talakaveri may have small entry charges
Accessibility: Hill roads; variable terrain; not fully wheelchair-friendly
Guided Tours: Local guides and coffee plantation tours available
Special Notes: Famous for coffee plantations and Kodava culture

Name: Jog Falls
Accessibility: Steps to viewpoints; not wheelchair-friendly
Guided Tours: Local guides available
Special Notes: One of India’s highest segmented waterfalls

Name: Gokarna
Timings: Temple timings per religious schedule; beaches open daylight hours
Entry Fee: Beaches generally free; temple may have fees
Accessibility: Sandy/rocky terrain; not wheelchair-friendly
Guided Tours: Local boat rides and trekking guides available
Special Notes: Popular for beach trekking and pilgrimage

Name: Udupi
Timings: Temple has regular darshan timings; beaches open daylight hours
Entry Fee: Temple donations/privileged sevas have fees; free darshan/basic access usually free
Accessibility: Temple complex has steps; beaches sandy—variable accessibility
Guided Tours: Temple management may provide information; local guides available for coastal tours
Special Notes: Famous for Udupi cuisine; ferry to St. Mary’s Island from Malpe

Name: Mangalore
Timings: Chapel and beaches follow daylight hours / church timings
Entry Fee: Not documented (beaches free; some heritage sites may have small fees)
Accessibility: Urban access good; beaches may have steps; partial wheelchair access in city
Guided Tours: City tours and local guides available
Parking: City parking and beach parking available

Name: Badami, Aihole & Pattadakal
Type: Historical Monuments / Temple Complexes / Archaeological Sites
Accessibility: Rocky/uneven surfaces; limited wheelchair access
Guided Tours: Local guides and ASI information boards
Special Notes: Pattadakal is a UNESCO World Heritage site

Name: Belur & Halebidu
Accessibility: Temple complexes have steps; not fully wheelchair-friendly
Guided Tours: Local guides available

Name: Shravanabelagola
Timings: Temple timings per Jain rituals; daylight access to the hill
Accessibility: Significant climb (600+ steps); not wheelchair-friendly
Guided Tours: Local guides available
Special Notes: Important Jain pilgrimage site; massive monolith

Name: Bandipur National Park
Official Website: Bandipur Tiger Reserve / Karnataka Forest Dept pages
Entry Fee: Safari fees, park entry fees vary
Accessibility: Safari roads vary; not wheelchair-friendly
Guided Tours: Forest department safaris with guided naturalists

Name: Nagarhole National Park / Kabini
Entry Fee: Safari and boat ride fees vary
Accessibility: Lodges/resorts provide boat safaris; limited wheelchair access
Guided Tours: Forest department & private lodge naturalists available

Name: Dandeli & Kali River
Accessibility: River/forest terrain; not wheelchair-friendly
Guided Tours: Local adventure operators provide guides

Name: Kudremukh
Accessibility: Trekking required to summit; not wheelchair-friendly
Guided Tours: Local trekking guides available

Name: Chikmagalur (Mullayanagiri, Baba Budangiri, Hebbe Falls)
Accessibility: Mountain roads; summit may require short trek; not wheelchair-friendly
Guided Tours: Local guides and trekking operators available

Name: Agumbe
Timings: Sunset timings for viewpoint; daylight access
Accessibility: Narrow hill roads; some viewpoints have steps; limited wheelchair access
Guided Tours: Naturalist guides for herpetofauna & forest walks available
Special Notes: Known as the “Cherrapunji of South India”

Name: Murudeshwar
Accessibility: Steps to temple complex; partial access
Guided Tours: Local guides and pilgrimage services available

Name: Karwar & Devbagh
Accessibility: Coastal access good; boat transfers to islands
Guided Tours: Boat tours, island resort guides available

Name: Srirangapatna
Timings: Temple and monuments follow standard visiting hours
Entry Fee: Some monuments / museums may have fees
Accessibility: Mostly approachable by road; step access in some sites
Guided Tours: Local guides available; historical tours common
Special Notes: Tipu Sultan’s summer palace, Ranganathaswamy temple

Name: B R Hills (Biligiriranga Hills)
Timings: Safari / park timings via forest dept
Accessibility: Hilly terrain; not wheelchair-friendly
Guided Tours: Forest guides and jeep safaris available

Name: Honnemaradu
Nearest Airport: Mangalore or Hubli depending on route
Accessibility: Water activity dependent; not wheelchair-friendly
Guided Tours: Local operators provide guides

Name: Chitradurga Fort
Entry Fee: ₹25 for Indian visitors, ₹300 for foreign visitors
Accessibility: Rocky and uneven terrain; not wheelchair-friendly
Guided Tours: Certified guides are available
Special Notes: Known as the Fort of Seven Circles

Name: Sringeri Sharada Peetham
Timings: Temple timings vary for darshan and sevas
Accessibility: Temple complex has steps; not fully wheelchair-friendly
Guided Tours: Temple staff can provide information
Special Notes: One of the four cardinal monasteries established by Adi Shankaracharya

Name: Kali Tiger Reserve
Timings: Safari timings: 6:00 AM–8:00 AM and 4:00 PM–6:00 PM
Entry Fee: Park entry fee is nominal; Safari fees start from ₹450-₹600
Accessibility: Terrain is rough; not wheelchair-friendly
Guided Tours: Guided safaris are mandatory
Parking: Available at the safari entry gates and resorts
Special Notes: Known for sightings of the Bengal Tiger, Black Panther, Indian Elephant
